FuncDef:
The match termination command terminates lower-priority ACL matching for the traffic that matches the PUPP service.
The undo match termination command restores the default configuration.
By default, lower-priority ACL matching is implemented for traffic that matches the PUPP service.
ExtraInfo: Currently, the user side supports the mirroring, Portal, PUPP, EDSG, DAA, and UCL services, whose priorities are listed in descending order (the priority of EDSG services is the same as that of DAA services). The PUPP policy can identify services that can be filtered based on their IP addresses. If lower-priority ACL matching is configured at this time, these services may be identified as another type. To prevent this problem, run the match termination command to configure lower-priority ACL matching termination.
